description.narrative: The objective of this project is the strengthening of the conservation, protection, and management of Key Marine Biodiversity Areas in the Philippines with the following sites TSPS, Davao , Lanuza Bay, Southern Palawan and VIP

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1. Number of ha covered under International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) Category V Protected Landscape and Seascape PAs in the 5 target sites. 2. Number of gender, indigenous peoples (IP) and climate change risk-sensitive Marine Protected Areas Network (MPAN) management plans formulated and implemented. 3. Extent to which gender, indigenous peoples (IP) and climate change risk-sensitive Marine Protected Areas Network (MPAN) management plans formulated and implemented. 4. Percent increase in Management Effectiveness Tracking Tool (METT) Scores in each of Lanuza Bay, TSPS, SP, VIP and DG target sites. 5. Number of gender, indigenous peoples (IP) and climate change risk-sensitive Marine Protected Area (MPA) management plans formulated and implemented. 6. Extent to which gender, indigenous peoples (IP) and climate change risk-sensitive Marine Protected Area (MPA) management plans formulated and implemented. 7. Percent increase in Management Effectiveness Tracking Tool (METT) Scores in each of the selected 95 MPAs targeted by Management Plan development and implementation. 8. Number of MPA and MPAN gender and IP sensitive management structures/bodies established and institutionalized. 9. Extent of participation of women and IP in management decision making, plan preparation and implementation. 10. Percent average increase in annual funding or other tangible support for capacity needs of at least 48 Marine Protected Areas and 3 Marine Protected Area Networks 11. Percent reduction or cost efficiency improvement of Marine Protected Areas when management functions are consolidated 12. Management costs of 20 Marine Protected Areas established and benchmarked 13. Number of sustainable financing plans implemented in participating Marine Protected Areas ( Verde Island Passage and Davao Gulf) 14. Extent of implementation of sustainable financing plans in participating Marine Protected Areas ( Verde Island Passage and Davao Gulf) 15. Percentage of Marine Protected Are
